name: UMenuAnchor
doc:
The Menu Anchor allows you to specify an location that a popup menu should be anchored to,
and should be summoned from.
* Single Child
* Popup

MenuClass:
The widget class to spawn when the menu is required.  Creates the widget freshly each time.
If you want to customize the creation of the popup, you should bind a function to OnGetMenuContentEvent
instead.
OnGetUserMenuContentEvent: Called when the menu content is requested to allow a more customized handling over what to display
ShouldFitInWindow: Should the menu anchor attempt to fit the menu inside the window.
UseApplicationMenuStack: Does this menu behave like a normal stacked menu? Set it to false to control the menu's lifetime yourself.
OnMenuOpenChanged: Called when the opened state of the menu changes
bFitInWindow: Should the menu anchor attempt to fit the menu inside the window.
Placement: The placement location of the summoned widget.

methods.name: Close
methods.doc: Closes the menu if it is currently open.

methods.name: HasOpenSubMenus
methods.doc: Returns whether this menu has open submenus

methods.name: IsOpen
methods.doc: Returns true if the popup is open; false otherwise.

methods.name: Open
methods.doc: Opens the menu if it is not already open

methods.name: ShouldOpenDueToClick
methods.doc:
Returns true if we should open the menu due to a click. Sometimes we should not, if
the same MouseDownEvent that just closed the menu is about to re-open it because it
happens to land on the button.

methods.name: ToggleOpen
methods.doc:
Toggles the menus open state.

@param bFocusOnOpen  Should we focus the popup as soon as it opens?
